org.flexiblepower.api.efi.commonhelper

Class TimerModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flexiblepower.efi.util.Timer
      • org.flexiblepower.api.efi.commonhelper.TimerModel

  • public class TimerModel
extends Timer
    The implementation of the timer that can change when new updates are received and that provides information on whether the timer is blocking or finished.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TimerModel(Timer base)
      Constructs a new timer.

      Returns the finishedAt moment.

      Returns whether the timer is blocking at this moment.
      void updateFinishedAt(java.util.Date finishedAt)
      A new finishedAt moment overwrites the old moment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimerModel

        public TimerModel(Timer base)
        Constructs a new timer.
        Parameters:
        base - The object that holds the information from the EFI message about the Timer.

    • Method Detail

      • updateFinishedAt

        public void updateFinishedAt(java.util.Date finishedAt)
        A new finishedAt moment overwrites the old moment.
        Parameters:
        finishedAt - The new date at which the timer should be finished.

      • getFinishedAt

        public java.util.Date getFinishedAt()
        Returns the finishedAt moment.
        Returns:
        The moment at which the timer is finished.

      • isBlockingAt

        public boolean isBlockingAt(java.util.Date moment)
        Returns whether the timer is blocking at this moment. No finishedAt time implies that this timer is not blocking.
        Parameters:
        moment - The timestamp for which we should check.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the timer is blocking or not at the given moment.
